name: The sum of odd numbers from the middle of the array to the end
instruction:
Write a function `sumOddFromMiddleToEnd` that takes one parameter, an array.

The array is of arbitrary length and consists of positive and negative integers.

The function should return the sum of odd numbers from the middle of the array to the end.

Before creating the `for` loop, create a variable to which you assign the value of half the length of the array, rounded down.

Use the method `Math.floor()` to round to the smaller side.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
sumOddFromMiddleToEnd([1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13])); // 7 + 9 + 11 + 13 = 40
sumOddFromMiddleToEnd([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 1])); // 5 + 7 + 1 = 13
sumOddFromMiddleToEnd([-1, -3, -5, -7, -9, -11])); // (-7) + (-9) + (-11) = -27
```
